parameters.name: acl
parameters.description: A pointer to the ACL that you want to convert into text.

parameters.name: len_p
parameters.description:
NULL, or a pointer to a location where the function can store the length
  of the string (not including the terminating null character).

full_content:
Function: acl_to_text
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/acl_to_text.html
Synopsis: char *acl_to_text( acl_t acl,
Headers: #include <sys/acl.h>
Parameters:
  - acl: A pointer to the ACL that you want to convert into text.
  - len_p: NULL, or a pointer to a location where the function can store the length
  of the string (not including the terminating null character).
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <sys/acl.h>

char *acl_to_text( acl_t acl,
                   ssize_t *len_p );
